intro: Galatella modesta, commonly known as the modest galatella, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, Galatella modesta is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
